revised_title: An Investigation of Anomalous Flow in Colloidal Systems
tldr: This article explores the anomalous flow of colloidal systems, focusing on the nature of the flow and its origin. The authors investigate the effects of concentration, rate of shear, and temperature on the rate of flow in various colloidal solutions, including soap films, gelatin, and myosin. They develop a method to measure the velocity distribution across the tube, providing insights into the behavior of these complex systems.
